raw_response: {"answer_index": 2, "answer_text": "Parry Romberg syndrome", "confidence": 9, "reasoning": "Parry Romberg syndrome (progressive hemifacial atrophy) is classified as a form of localized scleroderma, specifically linear scleroderma 'en coup de sabre'. It involves progressive atrophy of skin and soft tissues on one side of the face. Pierre Robin syndrome is a congenital condition with micrognathia and cleft palate. Gardner syndrome is a familial adenomatous polyposis variant. Merkelsson-Rosenthal syndrome involves facial paralysis, facial edema, and fissured tongue. Only Parry Romberg has a connection to scleroderma.", "evidence_quality": "normal"}
